item.title: Samsung Chromebook Plus Demo at CES 2017
item.description: This video is a quick hands on the Samsung Chromebook Plus by Robby Payne of Chrome Unboxed at CES 2017.

item.title: H6 AllWinner A10
item.description: The H6 is a low-cost 10 inch netbook from China powered by a 1.0GHz AllWinner A10 processor, a Mali 400 GPU and 512MB RAM, it comes pre-installed with Android.

item.title: 10-inch Sunlike Netbook Running Android Ice Cream Sandwich
item.description: This netbook by Sunlike, recently showcased at China Sourcing Fair, is powered by a 1.2GHz Boxchip A10 CPU, comes with 1GB RAM and runs Android.

item.title: GoClever I102 Netbook Unboxing
item.description: The GoClever I102 is yet another example of a recent ARM based netbook running Android, specifically version 2.3 of the mobile operating system.

item.title: ASUS Eee PC X101 with Android 4.0.3 Port for x86
item.description: In the last post we have seen Android running on the Wabook EPC1029, a netbook powered by an ARM based Rockchip CPU.

item.title: Low Price EPC1029D Android Netbook Spotted at CeBIT
item.description: Netbooks seem to be out of fashion but now and then a new device pops up, that fits into the netbook category, especially when tech exhibitions take place. One

item.title: Ubuntu Desktop Coming to Android Devices
item.description: Canonical has been working on bringing Android together with the Ubuntu desktop to create the killer app for multi-core phones in 2012 with both systems sharing

item.title: Android 3.2 Honeycomb on the ASUS Eee PC 1000HE
item.description: Android-x86 is an open source project with the goal to port Android to the x86 platform, so you can run Android on your laptop or PC.

item.title: Rockchip RK2918 Android Netbook at China Sourcing Fair
item.description: This video by Charbax from ARMdevices features a mini laptop he spotted at the recent China Sourcing Fair in Hong Kong. The Chinese product is powered by a 1.2

item.title: NEC 7-inch Netbook Powered by Tegra 2 Chip Running Android
item.description: Here is another non-tablet device that Charbax from ARMdevices spotted at CES 2011.
